text: Utva Aviation Industry (commonly known as UTVA) is a Serbian manufacturer of general aviation aircraft with the headquarters in Pančevo, Serbia. ==Name== In Serbian, Utva means common shelduck.LLC Utva Airline Industry, general information, published by Ministry of Economy of the Republic of Serbia, Retrieved on 2017-01-22. ==History== right|thumb|250px|Utva Plant Utva was founded on 5 June 1937 in Zemun, since 1940 located in Pančevo, produced simple gliders. In 1939 Utva began manufacturing light piston engine aircraft. During the NATO bombing of Yugoslavia in 1999, the factory was heavily damaged. In March 2017, Serbian defence company Yugoimport SDPR became the majority stakeholder of Utva with around 96% of total shares. ==Production== ===Lasta 95=== The Lasta 95 (Swallow 95) series is a profile designed as a primary training aircraft. The Iraqi Air Force is the first operator of the Lasta 95 ordering 20 aircraft with another 16 optional, in 2010. The Serbian Air Force has ordered 15 Lasta 95s.Uskoro pvre laste u Vojsci Srbije, Politika, 22. October 2011, Retrieved on 2017-01-22 ===Kobac=== The Kobac (Sparrowhawk) is a light military aircraft currently in development whose first flight took place in 2013.Predstavljen novi domaći avion kobac, Blic, 2 April 2012, Retrieved on 2017-01-22. ===Sova=== The Sova (Owl) is an aircraft currently in final of certification under CS.23 in General (4 seats, MTOW-1200 kg) and Utility (2 seats MTOW-1050 kg) whose first flight took place in 2018., Politika, 23 Avgust 2018, Retrieved on 2018-09-23. ==List of Utva aircraft== {| class="wikitable sortable" align=center style="font-size:90%;" |- |+ Summary of aircraft built by Utva |- style="background:#efefef;" !
